description: Single storey rear extension and covered loading bay to commercial facilities at ground floor level; change of use at first floor level from ancillary office space, and extensions at first and second floor levels to provide an additional nine residential units and external alterations to front and rear elevations
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s):  001, 002 Rev B, 009, 010 Rev F, 011 Rev F, 012 Rev F, 013 Rev D, 033 Rev A, 040 Rev E, 041 Rev F, 042 Rev F, 043 Rev F, 055 Rev E, 056 Rev F.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| The materials and finishes to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall match the existing building and be permanently retained as such.

Reason: To ensure that the materials and finishes are of high quality and contribute positively to the visual amenity of the locality in accordance with policies 1.1 (h) (g), 1.2(h), 2.1(c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies ELV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage, in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards, has been provided in an accessible location for flats as shown on approved plan 010 Rev F and have been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy, policy 7B of the Adopted Ealing Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policies 7.4, and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).

| Provision for cycle storage in accordance with adopted standards and as shown on approved plan 010 Rev F shall be provided prior to occupation of the units and be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.
Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and policy 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016).
| Prior to first occupation, an ultra-low NOx boiler with maximum NOx emissions of less than 0.030 g/kWh shall be installed in each dwelling and thereafter permanently retained.
Reason: In order to comply with Ealing Council's commitment to being an Air Quality Exemplar Borough and policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016).

| Prior to occupation of the development, sound insulation of the building envelope against external noise from transport and commercial/ cultural sources affecting the site, including glazing, acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building), shall be installed to achieve internal room and (if provided) external amenity noise standards in accordance with the criteria of BS8233:2014 and thereafter permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with the Adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) policy 7A, the Ealing Core Strategy (2012) policy 1.1(j), and policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Prior to occupation of the development, an enhanced sound insulation value DnT,w of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, shall be implemented for the floor/ceiling /wall structures separating different types of rooms/ uses in adjoining dwellings, namely bedrooms adjacent/above/below kitchen/dining/living room and communal entrances/hallways, and thereafter permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with the Adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) policy 7A, the Ealing Core Strategy (2012) policy 1.1(j), and policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Prior to use of any plant/ machinery/ equipment within the development, noise mitigation measures shall be implemented to ensure that the external sound level LAeq emitted from plant, machinery/ equipment will be lower than the lowest existing background sound level LA90 by at least 5 dBA in order to prevent any adverse impact on noise sensitive receivers in the surrounding area. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014 at the nearest and/or most affected noise sensitive premises, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity.  These mitigation meaasures shall thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with the Adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) policy 7A, the Ealing Core Strategy (2012) policy 1.1(j), and policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Prior to use, machinery, plant or equipment/ extract/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with the Adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) policy 7A, the Ealing Core Strategy (2012) policy 1.1(j), and policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Prior to commencement of the commercial part of the development, a Site Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council. Details shall include hours of use, times and frequency of activities, deliveries and collections, use of service yard and loading bay, vehicle movements, silent reversing methods, quiet loading/unloading measures, etc.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with the Adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) policy 7A, the Ealing Core Strategy (2012) policy 1.1(j), and policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Prior to occupation of the development, sound insulation shall be installed to the floor/ ceiling/ walls separating the commercial part of the premises from dwellings  with a sound insulation value DnT,w [and L'nT,w ] that is enhanced by at least 10-15dB above the minimum Building Regulations value for residential use and, where necessary, additional mitigation measures shall be implemented to contain commercial noise within the commercial premises and to achieve the criteria of BS8233:2014 within the dwellings/ noise sensitive premises. This sound insulation shall thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with the Adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) policy 7A, the Ealing Core Strategy (2012) policy 1.1(j), and policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
